thread.title: 27 Cheap Ways To Upgrade Your Home
thread.title_full: 27 Cheap Ways To Upgrade Your Home

author: Elena Garcia
title: 27 Cheap Ways To Upgrade Your Home
text:
View this image ›
Zoe Burnett / BuzzFeed We hope you love the products we recommend! Just so you know, BuzzFeed may collect a share of sales from the links on this page.
ID: 10299506 1. Give your home some character and add texture to your walls with peel-and-stick wall panels . amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $20 per panel.
ID: 10299110 2. Or create a charming accent wall with peel-and-stick paper , that can be easily removed. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it a 20.5”x18’ roll on Amazon starting at $32 . (Available in three color variations.)
ID: 10297664 3. Upgrade your countertops to faux granite with a DIY paint kit instead of replacing it and spending a fortune. amazon.com Get the kit on Amazon for $80 . (Available in four different color variations.)
ID: 10298122 4. Reseal all those unsightly cracks in your tub and tile with caulking and make your bathroom look new again. View this image ›
amazon.com Get some tips and tricks here and pick up caulking on Amazon for $7 .
ID: 10297649 5. Update recess lighting without doing any electrical work with magnetic shades . View this image ›
amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $25 .
ID: 10297656 6. Install crown molding to help make your home look historic and charming. amazon.com Crown molding is an easy, affordable way to update your home and add value for prospective buyers. Get a full tutorial from HGTV .
Finding molding on Amazon starting at $11 and these crown molding hangers for $23 .
ID: 10297641 7. Adding a fresh coat of paint to get that pop of color (or get rid of it) will give your home that touch-up without costing you a fortune. View this image ›
amazon.com Check out all the paint color options on Amazon . And see all the way you can update your space with paint here .
ID: 10297642 8. Get the stainless-steel appliances you’ve always wanted at a fraction of the price with paint . View this image ›
amazon.com Get the dishwasher and stove kit for $25 and the refrigerator kit for $80 on Amazon.
ID: 10297818 9. Add privacy, a touch of elegance, and make your windows look super expensive with with “leaded-glass” film . View this image ›
amazon.com Get a 24”x36” sheet on Amazon for $24 .
ID: 10297704 10. Paint your cabinets to give your kitchen that just-remodeled feeling for pennies versus what it would cost to replace them. View this image ›
designertrapped.com Get the full tutorial from Designer Trapped in a Lawyer’s Body .
ID: 10297702 11. Add a new tile backsplash to give your kitchen (or bathroom) that gorgeous custom look. View this image ›
amazon.com Instantly upgrade your kitchen with tiles that you can install yourself in just an afternoon. No grout need, just peel and stick them to a smooth clean surface.
Get a set of five 9.84”x9.3”x0.13” Smart Tile sheets starting at $24 .
ID: 10297766 12. Add a medallion to your light fixtures to instantly elevate your ceiling game. amazon.com , amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $23 .
ID: 10297734 13. Paint your ugly vinyl floors to get rid of the eyesore without ripping up the floor. View this image ›
designertrapped.com Get the full tutorial from Designer Trapped in a Lawyer’s Body .
ID: 10297646 14. Bulk up your baseboards with paint and extra trim instead of replacing them. thehouseofsmiths.com See the full tutorial at The House of Smith .
Get a 3/4”x3/4”x78” piece of wood trim from The Home Depot for $14.98 and a quart of paint from Amazon for $16 .
ID: 10297859 15. Install shelving systems in every room to add storage. View this image ›
amazon.com Get it on Amazon starting at $78 . And go here to get organizing tips.
ID: 10300389 16. Upgrade the fixtures in your bathroom to give yourself a mini spa experience. amazon.com , amazon.com Get the faucet for $33 and the shower head for $25 on Amazon.
ID: 10297700 17. Swap the handles on your cabinets and drawers to update your kitchen. View this image ›
amazon.com Get a set of 10 on Amazon for $19 .
ID: 10297750 18. Add a doorbell to your home if you don’t already have one, or upgrade your current one. amazon.com Get this one on Amazon for $19 . (Available in a variety of color options.)
ID: 10297672 19. Paint inexpensive area rugs to liven up any room. View this image ›
thehouseofsmiths.com Get the full tutorial from The House of Smiths and pick up an affordable area rug from Amazon.
ID: 10297776 20. Add some curb appeal and a pop of color by painting your front door . Get a quart on Amazon starting at $35 . (Available in a variety of color options.) amazon.com , amazon.com Get a quart on Amazon starting at $35 . (Available in a variety of color options.)
ID: 10297685 21. Forget interior designers! Find matching fabrics, paints, and materials with a color match tool . View this image ›
amazon.com Match any color to your preferred paint brand or the perfect material with the Color Muse. Just scan the color and get recommendations sent to your smart device.
Get it on Amazon for $49 .
ID: 10300919 22. Get even more curb appeal by sanding down and painting rusted railings . View this image ›
remodelandolacasa.com Get the full tutorial from Remodelando la Casa .
ID: 10297850 23. Consider these useful tips for upgrading your bathroom. View this image ›
blog.decorplanet.com Get more tips and find all the products you’ll need to upgrade your bathroom at Decor Planet .
ID: 10297759 24. Cover door scuffs and prevent new damage with a metal kick plate . amazon.com Get it on Amazon for $18 .
ID: 10297698 25. Add molding on top of cabinets to give them that built-in, custom-made look. View this image ›
remodelandolacasa.com Get the full tutorial from Remodelando La Casa .
ID: 10297860 26. Add adhesive mirrored tiles to the underside or top of your cabinets to subtly reflect light and make your space look brighter. View this image ›
amazon.com Get a set of 18 on Amazon for $9 .
ID: 10297736 27. And update light switches to give your home a fresh look and a tech upgrade. amazon.com The Honeywell Econoswitch lets you program your light switch to turn on and off automatically so you’re not wasting electricity. Best part they’re super easy to install.
Get it on Amazon for $35 .
ID: 10297660 View this image ›
